title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 22 august [1871]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 22 August [1871]
text: 1871AugustAugust 22 tuesdayTuesday evening 6 oclocko'clock and no letter from waltWalt and nobody else as to Jeff he dontdon't never write to me in these days i have written to him but dontdon't receive any letter from him or mattyMatty well waltWalt i gessguess i shall get one from you to morrow you must write waltWalt when you will come if you can tell so long before hand well waltWalt who do you think has been here to day mrsMrs. HindsHine charleysCharley's widow she and her oldest daughter have come on here for a short time probably to see something about disposing of his pictures her daughter didentdidn't come here as she was not very well but a lady by the name of mrsMrs. judsonJudson came with her poor woman i felt great sympathy for her if i had had 5 dollerdollars in my possession in the world i would have given it to her i dontdon't know as she is so very needeyneedy but i felt as if i wanted to assist her a little she says it looks very dark bforebefore her but she thinks she shall remain in new havenNew Haven for the present you must write to her waltWalt and to townsenTownsend she said townsendTownsend has a colulmcolumn and a half in the new haven paper concerning you and they thought so strange they didentdidn't hear from youi feel pretty smart only quite lame my limbs have pained me more lately but write waltWalt if you have not but i think you have Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 22 August [1871]
